definition: to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

sentences.english: Every bike rider should wear a safety helmet.
sentences.chinese: 每个骑车人都应当佩戴安全帽。

sentences.english: All the soldiers must pin their armbands on.
sentences.chinese: 所有的战士都必须佩戴袖章。
母亲节那天，在胸前佩戴石竹花。

sentences.english: S38:In case of insufficient ventilation, wear suitable respiratory equipment.
sentences.chinese: 通风不良时，须佩戴适当的呼吸器。

sentences.english: So you'll get to wear a little skull on your flight suit.
sentences.chinese: 因此你们将在飞行服上佩戴上一个小骷髅。

sentences.english: Don't constrict your breasts because of your shyness, and don't wear bra too early.
sentences.chinese: 不能因为害羞而束胸，也不能过早佩戴胸罩。

sentences.english: Points left and right, to wear more comfortable, the bottom line is thick noodles.
sentences.chinese: 分左右手，佩戴更舒适，底线面线都是粗线。

sentences.english: Would you like to wear jewelleries in the future?
sentences.chinese: 您将来会有佩戴的意向吗？

sentences.english: These hoop earrings are savvy and spunky and love to be worn frequently.
sentences.chinese: 这些箍耳环是精明的，有勇气，喜欢佩戴频繁。

sentences.english: Any railway worker when carrying out transport safety inspection shall bear an on-duty identification sign.
sentences.chinese: 实施运输安全检查的铁路职工应当佩戴执勤标志。

sentences.english: Because the injured captain John Terry, Rio Ferdinand will continue to wear the captain armband.
sentences.chinese: 因为队长特里的受伤，费迪南德将继续佩戴队长袖标。

sentences.english: Should he or she elect to wear a belly button ring or a barbell?
sentences.chinese: 她或者他，选择佩戴肚脐环还是肚脐铃？

sentences.english: Q. How do I learn how to put on and use a respirator?
sentences.chinese: 怎样才能学习到呼吸防护用品的佩戴和使用方法？

sentences.english: Adorning the Jin Dashan of milistary exploit chapter is demobilized from army before the bosom, returned home town.
sentences.chinese: 胸前佩戴着军功章的金大山从部队复员，回到了家乡。

sentences.english: The Bark Control Collar effectively and humanely stops all barking when it is worn.
sentences.chinese: 只有在佩戴止吠项圈时，它才会有效的阻止狗狗吠叫。

definition: to wear (as accessories)/carry at the waist
to put on/to wear (mouthguard, contact lenses, hearing aid etc)
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
